DOC.brief_summary: Intermittent Pringle's maneuver is widely used to limit blood loss during hepatectomy, without an established time-limit. However, many authors claims its danger for patients' outcome. The investigators check the short term outcome of a consecutive cohort of patients who underwent hepatectomy with intermittent clamping exceeding 120 minutes.
DOC.brief_title: Pringle Time Exceeding 120 Min in Liver Resection
DOC.criteria: patients in whom total cumulative clamping time exceeded 60 minutes. patients in whom total cumulative clamping time was less than 60 minutes
